byline.original: By JONATHAN MAHLER and YAMICHE ALCINDOR

abstract: Some liberal Democrats fret that Sen Bernie Sanders, despite having blazed trail to left, may lose his bid to leave abiding legacy by continuing fight to win presidential nomination; next generation of progressives are seen as possibly carrying his vision forward as he inevitably leaves political scene, but are not getting support from him to go beyond campaign and construct broader progressive movement.

headline.print_headline: Fixated on Campaign Fight, Sanders Risks Lasting Legacy
headline.main: Bernie Sanders Makes a Campaign Mark. Now, Can He Make a Legacy?

snippet: Far from laying the foundation to transform a presidential bid into a fierce progressive movement, Mr. Sanders is wrapped up in the race itself.
lead_paragraph: Far from laying the foundation to transform a presidential bid into a fierce progressive movement, Mr. Sanders is wrapped up in the race itself.
